revised_title: Optical Rectification in Ammonium Dihydrogen Phosphate, Potassium Dihydrogen Phosphate, and Quartz: Improved Accuracy and Sign Determination
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on ammonium dihydrogen phosphate, potassium dihydrogen phosphate, and quartz to study optical rectification, a phenomenon where a steady polarization is produced in a medium when an intense light beam propagates through it. They achieved improved accuracy and determined the signs of the optical rectification coefficients for these materials. The results were consistent with the theoretical relation between linear electro-optic and optical rectification coefficients, providing insights into the nature of the underlying processes.
